channel.title: Online Java Game?
channel.description:
Just for fun, I kinda feel like making a basic game, kinda like crappy runescape clone, that has the features of multiple people interacting, items, and objects, but then I started to question the idea since making a Java game secure seems difficult, along with what would be handled client side, since it seems like most MMORPG stuff is calculated server side now a days.
Would making a basic online game secure be difficult, and would I need a very good server to handle most of the game calculations to prevent basic attempts of cheating?
I just want to clarify, I'm not trying to make the next MMORPG, I just want to make my first game that includes online play, and I thought that Java would be easiest and most fun to do this with. I'm not planning on it going anywhere.

Make a 2 player pong game to start

just wondering is there any online multi player pongs?
that you play over the net with random peeps?
[/quote]
just wondering is there any online search engines?
that you search for terms on random websites?

YES U FOOL, MUAHAHAHA[/quote]

CONGRATULATIONS YOU JUST ADVANCED ONE TWAT LEVEL

item.title: Online Java Game?
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:15, topic:326351”][quote author=Tenac link=topic=422763.msg3103801#msg3103801 date=1263944231]

[quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=422763.msg3103741#msg3103741 date=1263937914]

erm i didnt no runescape was unsecure wat makes u think java is unsecure?/?

I never said RuneScape was unsecure, but I know the Java .jar can be downloaded, decompiled/deobfuscated, and possibly hacked.
[/quote]so can any other game…

I know any game can be cheated/hacked, but if you compare C++ to Java, it’s obvious which is easier to crack
[/quote]umm no, its not obvious. its a matter on whether you know assembly better than java bytecode or not[/quote]
abraham be right fur once.

Read full topic

item.title: Online Java Game?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“Tenac, post:6, topic:326351”]My problem isn’t making the game, that’s a piece of cake, the problem is I barely even know where to start when it comes to clients/servers, databases, and that stuff haha. I just felt like making a thread since I’m doing a bunch of research and wanted to take a break and get some opinions :P.

If anyone wants to throw out any tips about the database design and that shit, I’d take it haha. I’m realizing this thread is pointless, but it’s already been posted and I’m going to bed, g’night everyone :)[/quote]
Way to contradict yourself in bold. If a game was as easy to make as saying “its gonna have horses and exploding semen bombs” then I’d be a millionaire. The coding is the hard part.

Read full topic

item.title: Online Java Game?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Tenac, post:6, topic:326351”][quote author=Davidude link=topic=422763.msg3103379#msg3103379 date=1263886905]
How about instead of making a thread about it, you actually jump right in and start coding it? Yes Java is a good choice.
[/quote]
My problem isn’t making the game, that’s a piece of cake, the problem is I barely even know where to start when it comes to clients/servers, databases, and that stuff haha. I just felt like making a thread since I’m doing a bunch of research and wanted to take a break and get some opinions :P.

If anyone wants to throw out any tips about the database design and that shit, I’d take it haha. I’m realizing this thread is pointless, but it’s already been posted and I’m going to bed, g’night everyone :)[/quote]
uuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuh, that is making the game

Read full topic

item.title: Online Java Game?
item.dc:creator: @Tenac Tenac
item.description:
@Tenac wrote:

Davidude:

How about instead of making a thread about it, you actually jump right in and start coding it? Yes Java is a good choice.

My problem isn’t making the game, that’s a piece of cake, the problem is I barely even know where to start when it comes to clients/servers, databases, and that stuff haha. I just felt like making a thread since I’m doing a bunch of research and wanted to take a break and get some opinions :P.

If anyone wants to throw out any tips about the database design and that shit, I’d take it haha. I’m realizing this thread is pointless, but it’s already been posted and I’m going to bed, g’night everyone

Read full topic
